cālikapabbata：cālikapabbata（pu）
စာလိကပဗ္ဗတ（ပု）
[cālika+pabbata]
[စာလိက+ပဗ္ဗတ]

Cālikapabbata：A hill near Cālikā where the Buddha stayed during his visits to Cālikā．

The hill was quite white in colour，and on dark nights，such as the night of the new moon，it gave the impression of moving hither and thither，hence its name （AA．ii．793; UdA．217）．But see Cālikā．

cālikapabbata：စာလိကပဗ္ဗတ （ပု）
[စာလိက+ပဗ္ဗတ]
စာလိကတောင်။ စာလိကပဗ္ဗတမဟာဝိဟာရ-ကြည့်။
